intro: Phyllanthus gunnii, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a unique ability to regenerate from its rhizomes, making it resilient to environmental stress. Its fibrous bark was historically used by Māori for making rope and clothing.
